project.nixi.context: Contexto: Nixi For Children es una startup con sede en Barcelona, que ayuda a familias de todo el mundo a desarrollar experiencias inmersivas de realidad virtual para reducir la ansiedad de los pacientes.

project.nixi.process3: - 40% de ellos busca informaci√≥n en internet.
project.nixi.process4: - 40% Busca informaci√≥n preguntando a amigos y familiares.
project.nixi.process5: - 57% han compartido informaci√≥n con otros padres.
project.nixi.process6: Definir el problema: Es as√≠ como detectamos que los padres tambi√©n sufren de ansiedad generada al separarse de los hijos, sentirse solos o no tener suficiente informaci√≥n. Idear: Muro de la familia Nixi. Cuidar a la familia es tan importante como cuidar al paciente. Creamos una comunidad que acompa√±a a la familia en todas las etapas, compartiendo informaci√≥n entre padres, apoyando y creando v√≠nculos. Proceso: Nixi conecta a familias que quieren ayudar y necesitan apoyo. De esta manera construimos comunidades de apoyo entre familias. Prototipo mvp (producto m√≠nimo viable) Implementaci√≥n utilizando el hashtag #NixiFamilyWall para impulsar trafico a redes sociales. Test: Cre√© un sistema de dise√±o que pueda escalar. La app puede ser escalable a un progressive web app, que  tambi√©n se puede instalar en el tel√©fono a trav√©s del sitio web actual.

project.flitter.context: Context: As a student of the Women in Tech Web Development Bootcamp, I had the opportunity to work on an exciting project called Flitter. It was an excellent opportunity for me to apply the web development skills I learned during the bootcamp. By creating a replica of Twitter, I learned how to build a full-stack web application that included user authentication, data storage, and a user interface.
project.flitter.challenges: Main Challenges: The team's goal was to create a clone of the popular social media platform Twitter.
project.flitter.user: User I Persona: Individuals who enjoy using social media platforms, particularly those who are familiar with and enjoy using Twitter.
project.flitter.process1: Planning and ideation: The first step in creating Flitter was to plan and ideate the project. This involved discussing and brainstorming ideas with the team, identifying the key features and functionalities to include in the MVP, and creating a roadmap for development.
project.flitter.process2: Design and user interface: Once the ideation process was complete, the team focused on designing the user interface and user experience. This involved creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to ensure the app's design was intuitive, user-friendly, and visually appealing.
project.flitter.process3: Development: With the design and user interface in place, the team began developing the app's core functionalities, such as user authentication, profile creation, tweeting, following and unfollowing other users, and liking and disliking fleets.
project.flitter.process4: Testing and debugging: As development progressed, the team conducted extensive testing and debugging to ensure the app's functionality was consistent and free of errors. This involved using various testing methods, such as unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing.
project.flitter.process5: Deployment: Once the app was fully developed and tested, it was deployed to a server for public use. This involved configuring the server and deploying the app to ensure it was accessible to users.
